SENT.plain: Lymphomatous meningitis and lymphoma confined to the central nervous system are the most serious neurological diseases in patients with human immunodeficiency virus infection
The diagnosis is difficult and it is usually done with advanced systemic disease or when the chemotherapy is finished
During a ten month period, three patients with lymphomatous meningitis and HIV infection were diagnosed in an Infectious Diseases Unit
In one patient, was the initial clinical manifestation of Burkitt's lymphoma and in another, the diagnosis was concomitant with the neoplasm
In the last one, there was a meningeal recidiva afterwards he had received chemotherapy and, theoretically, cured his systemic lymphoma
Clinical, cytologic, immunologic and evolutive study of these three patients is done
It is discussed the meningeal prophylaxis usefulness with intrathecal chemotherapy
